author: Luis Serrano
comment: Was a nice app but recently twist-to-count feature works inaccurate on LG G Watch R with 5.1.1. Some twists are ignored even if you wait some time between attempts.
title: Twist-to-count does not work properly

author: Anne Uski
comment: Now has Moto 360 support. "OK Google, start counter" opens app. When your watch needs to wake up, continue counting by sliding the notification card up into view.

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Anne, thanks for your feedback! Wear Counter was just updated to release 1.0.0 and it's shipping round devices support. Enjoy :)

title: Works great!

author: David Hudec
comment: Remembers your count until you reset it, additional options allows for substraction if mistaken, or add from the notification card. Great for beer counting in the pub.
title: Easy

author: Vijay Baliga
comment: Excellent app! I use it daily. Can you make it available in black so that it will conserve battery?

author: Pamela Dobson
comment: Works very well as a row counter for knitting. I especially like the notification cards so the watch screen can be in ambient mode most of the time. Twist to count looks interesting, but not for knitting!

author: malkit benning
comment: I can see me using this in supermarket etc. It would be great to be able to configure the colour.
title: Cool app just missing custom colour

author: Vanessa Cottrell
comment: I tried a few other counter app's but I like this one the best.  It has a more intuitive layout for me, few permissions and I like the bright colors.  I use it as a row counter when I'm knitting.  It's very handy!
title: Wonderful

author: Andrew Birch
comment: Perfect counter for wear now it has added a notification card

author: Ja Kub
comment: Great app to count shots, so next day you know why you have hangover :)
title: Moto 360

author: Chris Stanley
comment: Works now! Thank you!

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Chris, thanks for your feedback! Wear Counter was just updated to release 1.0.0 and it's shipping round devices support. Enjoy :)

title: Moto 360

author: Alan Fregtman
comment: Twist-to-count not working on Huawei Watch.

author: Matt Shockley
comment: counts better than I do

author: Kerry Austin
comment: Couldn't ask for more.
title: Prefect.

author: Gary Peters
comment: Does what it's supposed to do!
title: Great

author: Piotr Malak
comment: Great job

author: Amir Rahmamzadeh
comment: Useful

author: John Michaels
comment: Now has round device support!

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi John, thanks for your feedback! Wear Counter was just updated to release 1.0.0 and it's shipping round devices support. Enjoy :)

author: Laswhawn Wiley
comment: I want to keep this app because i have several uses for it but the following changes would make this a must have app. 1. Round support.   2. When i wake my watch this app should still be running.  Re launching it takes too much time.  3. Should have abilities to keep multiple counts with diff color backgrounds to differentiate between the two. 4. Ok google can't differentiate between the word where from wear on launch unless i spell w.e.a.r when voice launching. These 4 changes would make this a killer app.
title: I really like this app but....

author: Antony Mouse
comment: Great idea but does not fit properly on the Moto 360. Also, please consider changing the voice command, in English google now always interprets 'wear' as 'where', making it impossible to open apps with 'wear' in the title by voice.

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Antony, thanks for your feedback! Wear Counter was just updated to release 1.0.0 and it's shipping round devices support. Enjoy :)

title: Moto 360

author: Brandon Kuenzi
comment: Would give it 5 stars but the lower buttons don't show up on moto 360. Please follow Googles design standard and make a separate UI for round displays. Again: Great app

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Brandon, thanks for your feedback! Wear Counter was just updated to release 1.0.0 and it's shipping round devices support. Enjoy :)

title: Beautiful, solid app. Needs round support.

author: Sergio Civetta
comment: Super helpful app to count and keep tally of things throughout the day, like how many glasses of water you've consumed.
title: Really helpful and simple

author: Christopher Acosta
comment: The app only half works on circular watches. You can count forever, but you can't restart the count nor can you subtract a mistake.

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Christopher, thanks for your feedback! Wear Counter was just updated to release 1.0.0 and it's shipping round devices support. Enjoy :)

title: Ever heard of circles?

author: Torrey Trahanovsky
comment: Amazing app NEEDS CIRCLES

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Torrey, thanks for your feedback! Wear Counter was just updated to release 1.0.0 and it's shipping round devices support. Enjoy :)

author: Dew Alam
comment: An option to disable vibrate would be nice though!

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content:
Hi Dew, thanks for your feedback! I'm glad you liked Wear Counter :)
About the vibration disabling: more customization options are going to be shipped in next releases, especially to enhance the twist-to-count feature!

title: Simple and useful :)

author: Scott Jenson
comment: Works perfectly. Big plus for me: the counter persists between times toy use it. This allows me to count things throughout the day

author: Mike Colmo
comment: Error 194

reply.author: Luigi Notaro
reply.content: Hi Mike, the Error 194 is not related to Wear Counter - the Play Store is responsible for that. Please check the Google Play Help Forum https://productforums.google.com/forum/#!topic/play/hIIJ1nauNf4
